標.definition: mark; sign; label; to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc; to bear (a brand name, registration number etc); prize; award; bid; target; quota; (old) the topmost branches of a tree; visible symptom; classifier for military units

標價.definition: to mark the price; marked price

標兵.definition: parade guards (usually spaced out along parade routes); example; model; pacesetter

標定.definition: to stake out (the boundaries of a property etc); to demarcate; (engineering etc) to calibrate

標尺.definition: surveyor's rod; staff; staff gauge; rear sight

標幟.definition: banner; standard; variant of 標誌|标志[biao1zhi4]

標底.definition: base number (of a tender); starting price (for auction)

標新取異.definition: to start on sth new and different (idiom); to display originality

標新立異.definition: to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)

標新競異.definition: to start on sth new and different (idiom); to display originality

標新領異.definition: to bring in the new (idiom); new directions, different creation

標普.definition: Standard and Poor (share index); abbr. for 標準普爾|标准普尔[Biao1 zhun3 Pu3 er3]

標書.definition: bid or tender submission or delivery; bid or tender document

標會.definition: private loan association where money is allocated through bidding; meeting of such an association; to win the bidding at such a meeting

標本.definition: specimen; sample; the root cause and symptoms of a disease

標杆.definition: surveyor's pole; post (used for a landmark); (fig.) goal; model; benchmark

標柱.definition: distance marker; pole marking distance on racetrack

標榜.definition: to flaunt; to advertise; to parade; boost; excessive praise

標注.definition: to mark out; to tag; to put a sign on sth explaining or calling attention to; to annotate (e.g. a character with its pinyin)

標清.definition: standard definition (TV or video image quality)

標準.definition: standard; norm; criterion; (adjective) standard; good; correct; conforming to a standard

標準普爾.definition: Standard and Poor's (S&P), company specializing in financial market ratings; S&P financial index

標準狀態.definition: standard conditions for temperature and pressure

標準狀況.definition: standard conditions for temperature and pressure

標準間.definition: standard (hotel) room; two-person room of standard size and amenities; abbr. to 標間|标间[biao1 jian1]

標準音.definition: standard pronunciation; standard tone (e.g. A = 440 Hz)

標牌.definition: label; tag; sign; (brass etc) inscribed plate

標界.definition: to demarcate a boundary; dividing line

標的.definition: target; aim; objective; what one hopes to gain

標竿.definition: benchmark; pole serving as mark or symbol; pole with a trophy hung on it

標線.definition: marking line (painted on a road to guide motorists); reticle; graticule

標繪.definition: to plot (on a chart); to mark

標記.definition: sign; mark; symbol; to mark up; (computing) token

標誌.definition: sign; mark; symbol; logo; to symbolize; to indicate; to mark

標語.definition: written slogan; placard; CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1],條|条[tiao2]

標賣.definition: to sell at marked price; to sell by tender

標配.definition: to provide as a standard feature; standard feature; standard equipment; standard configuration; (abbr. for 標準配置|标准配置[biao1 zhun3 pei4 zhi4])

標金.definition: standard gold bar; deposit when submitting a tender

標間.definition: abbr. for 標準間|标准间[biao1 zhun3 jian1], standard (hotel) room

標音法.definition: phonetic transcription; system of representing spoken sounds

標題黨.definition: "sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users; clickbait

標點.definition: punctuation; a punctuation mark; to punctuate; CL:個|个[ge4]
